channel.title: Transparency HUD (Plasma TV friendly)
channel.description: I'm planing to buy a Plasma TV next month and Black Mesa will be one of the first "content" I'm going to use with it. I'm concerned about HUD though, it's completely not transparency and after few hours of playing I could get some burn-in problems (due to not yet-used display). Is it possible to set HUD transparency or will it be possible in the near future? PS. This mod almost killed me with it's awesomeness.

r4fku:

I’m planing to buy a Plasma TV next month and Black Mesa will be one of the first “content” I’m going to use with it. I’m concerned about HUD though, it’s completely not transparency and after few hours of playing I could get some burn-in problems (due to not yet-used display). Is it possible to set HUD transparency or will it be possible in the near future? PS. This mod almost killed me with it’s awesomeness.

I think that most modern plasma screens don’t have too much of an issue with burn-in. I played good old Return to Castle Wolfenstein in several sessions of a few hours with my PC hooked up to my 50-inch panasonic plasma screen, was only a month or two old. The HUD in that game doesn’t have any transparency so those icons were on screen a long time, but doesn’t seem to have done any harm.

item.title: Transparency HUD (Plasma TV friendly)
item.dc:creator: Jenova19
item.description:
Type this in the console and hit ENTER on your keyboard:

cl_drawhud 0

To disable it.

cl_drawhud 1

To enable it.

v - How-To enable the console in Black Mesa - v

  1. Close Black Mesa.
  2. Open Steam.
  3. Browse to the Library (All Games).
  4. Right click “Black Mesa”.
  5. Click “Properties” (on the bottom of the menu).
  6. Click “Set Launch Options…”.
  7. Type “-console” (without “”).
  8. Click “OK”.
  9. Close the “Black Mesa - Properties” window.
  10. Start the game.
